info.title: Solar System openData
info.description: API to get all data about all solar system objects

tags.name: bodies
tags.description: Object with all data about the concerned body : orbitals, physicals and atmosphere

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data you want to retrieve (comma separated). Example: id,semimajorAxis,isPlanet.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: One or more data you want to exclude (comma separated). Example: id,isPlanet.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: A data you want to sort on and the sort direction (comma separated). Example: id,desc. Only one data is authorized.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (number>=1) and page size (size>=1 and 20 by default) (comma separated). NB: You cannot use "page" without "order"! Example: 1,10.

parameters.name: rowData
parameters.description: Transform the object in records. NB: This can also be done client-side in JavaScript!

parameters.name: filter[]
parameters.description: Filters to be applied. Each filter consists of a data, an operator and a value (comma separated). Example: id,eq,mars. Accepted operators are : cs (like) - sw (start with) - ew (end with) - eq (equal) - lt (less than) - le (less or equal than) - ge (greater or equal than) - gt (greater than) - bt (between). And all opposites operators : ncs - nsw - new - neq - nlt - nle - nge - ngt - nbt. Note : if anyone filter is invalid, all filters will be ignore.

parameters.name: satisfy
parameters.description: Should all filters match (default)? Or any?
